description.value:
This is an optional class feature. Consult with your DM before adding this to your character.

This 3rd-level feature replaces the @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-class-features.BMRXDrnJcp28Bz5j]{Primeval Awareness} feature. You gain no benefit from the replaced feature and don't qualify for anything in the game that requires it.

You can focus your awareness through the interconnections of nature: you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class if you don't already know them, as shown in the Primal Awareness Spells table. These spells don't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

Ranger Level Spell
3rd @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.WuV0W27jsok4w90U]{Speak with Animals}
5th @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.pW1LnqfZBBYTQcUj]{Beast Sense}
9th @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.96YjcelItU5afhAp]{Speak with Plants}
13th @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.es04c1GiG2bGlCUz]{Locate Creature}
17th @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.8S4YTxdj3UzHsfy2]{Commune with Nature}

You can cast each of these spells once without expending a spell slot. Once you cast a spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Note: To be able to cast these spells normally and also keep track of your use per long rest, add the corresponding spell to your character sheetÂ twice. Set one copy to a Preparation Mode of Innate with 1 use per long rest. Set the second copy's Preparation Mode to Always Prepared.

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.
